actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8932 — "To establish an earlier application processing cycle for the FAFSA."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 8932, the Chair put the question on passage of the bill and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Foxx demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8932, H.R. 7409 and H.R. 8446. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8932, H.R. 7409, and H.R. 8446 under a closed rule, and provides for one hour of debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1568. H.R. 8932 — "To establish an earlier application processing cycle for the FAFSA."

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on November 14, 2024, at 4:20 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 1316, S. 4716, S. 5314, H.R. 5464, H.R. 5861, H.R. 6324, and H.R. 7333. Appointments: The National Council on Disability and United States Semiquincentennial Commission.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Pastor Timothy McLaurin, First Missionary Baptist Church, Frederick, Maryland.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
